lines.line_text: FAR in the windings of a vale,
Fast by a sheltering wood,
The safe retreat of health and peace,
An humble cottage stood.

stanzas.stanza_text:
FAR in the windings of a vale,
Fast by a sheltering wood,
The safe retreat of health and peace,
An humble cottage stood.

lines.line_text: There beauteous EMMA flourish'd fair,
Beneath a mother's eye;
Whose only wish on earth was now
To see her blest, and die.

stanzas.stanza_text:
There beauteous EMMA flourish'd fair,
Beneath a mother's eye;
Whose only wish on earth was now
To see her blest, and die.

lines.line_text: The softest blush that Nature spreads
Gave colour to her cheek:
Such orient colour smiles thro' heaven,
When vernal mornings break.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The softest blush that Nature spreads
Gave colour to her cheek:
Such orient colour smiles thro' heaven,
When vernal mornings break.

lines.line_text: Nor let the pride of great ones scorn
This charmer of the plains:
That sun, who bids their diamond blaze,
To paint our lilly deigns.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Nor let the pride of great ones scorn
This charmer of the plains:
That sun, who bids their diamond blaze,
To paint our lilly deigns.

lines.line_text: Long had she fill'd each youth with love,
Each maiden with despair;
And tho' by all a wonder own'd,
Yet knew not she was fair.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Long had she fill'd each youth with love,
Each maiden with despair;
And tho' by all a wonder own'd,
Yet knew not she was fair.

lines.line_text: Till EDWIN came, the pride of swains,
A soul devoid of art;
And from whose eye, serenely mild,
Shone forth the feeling heart,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Till EDWIN came, the pride of swains,
A soul devoid of art;
And from whose eye, serenely mild,
Shone forth the feeling heart,

lines.line_text: A mutual flame was quickly caught:
Was quickly too reveal'd:
For neither bosom lodg'd a wish,
That virtue keeps conceal'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
A mutual flame was quickly caught:
Was quickly too reveal'd:
For neither bosom lodg'd a wish,
That virtue keeps conceal'd.

lines.line_text: What happy hours of home-felt bliss
Did love on both bestow!
But bliss too mighty long to last,
Where fortune proves a foe.

stanzas.stanza_text:
What happy hours of home-felt bliss
Did love on both bestow!
But bliss too mighty long to last,
Where fortune proves a foe.

lines.line_text: His sister, who, like ENVY form'd,
Like her in mischief joy'd,
To work them harm, with wicked skill,
Each darker art employ'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
His sister, who, like ENVY form'd,
Like her in mischief joy'd,
To work them harm, with wicked skill,
Each darker art employ'd.

lines.line_text: The father too, a sordid man,
Who love nor pity knew,
Was all-unfeeling as the clod,
From whence his riches grew.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The father too, a sordid man,
Who love nor pity knew,
Was all-unfeeling as the clod,
From whence his riches grew.

lines.line_text: Long had he seen their secret flame,
And seen it long unmov'd:
Then with a father's frown at last
Had sternly disapprov'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Long had he seen their secret flame,
And seen it long unmov'd:
Then with a father's frown at last
Had sternly disapprov'd.

lines.line_text: In EDWIN's gentle heart, a war
Of differing passions strove:
His heart, that durst not disobey,
Yet could not cease to love.

stanzas.stanza_text:
In EDWIN's gentle heart, a war
Of differing passions strove:
His heart, that durst not disobey,
Yet could not cease to love.

lines.line_text: Deny'd her sight, he oft behind
The spreading hawthorn crept,
To snatch a glance, to mark the spot
Where EMMA walk'd and wept.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Deny'd her sight, he oft behind
The spreading hawthorn crept,
To snatch a glance, to mark the spot
Where EMMA walk'd and wept.

lines.line_text: Oft too on STANEMORE's wintry waste,
Beneath the moonlight-shade,
In sighs to pour his soften'd soul,
The midnight-mourner stray'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oft too on STANEMORE's wintry waste,
Beneath the moonlight-shade,
In sighs to pour his soften'd soul,
The midnight-mourner stray'd.

lines.line_text: His cheek, where health with beauty glow'd,
A deadly pale o'ercast:
So fades the fresh rose in its prime,
Before the northern blast.

stanzas.stanza_text:
His cheek, where health with beauty glow'd,
A deadly pale o'ercast:
So fades the fresh rose in its prime,
Before the northern blast.

lines.line_text: The parents now, with late remorse,
Hung o'er his dying bed;
And weary'd heaven with fruitless vows,
And fruitless sorrow shed.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The parents now, with late remorse,
Hung o'er his dying bed;
And weary'd heaven with fruitless vows,
And fruitless sorrow shed.

lines.line_text: 'Tis past! he cry'd  but if your souls
Sweet mercy yet can move,
Let these dim eyes once more behold,
What they must ever love!

stanzas.stanza_text:
'Tis past! he cry'd  but if your souls
Sweet mercy yet can move,
Let these dim eyes once more behold,
What they must ever love!

lines.line_text: She came; his cold hand softly touch'd,
And bath'd with many a tear:
Fast-falling o'er the primrose pale,
So morning dews appear.

stanzas.stanza_text:
She came; his cold hand softly touch'd,
And bath'd with many a tear:
Fast-falling o'er the primrose pale,
So morning dews appear.

lines.line_text: But oh! his sister's jealous care,
A cruel sister she!
Forbade what EMMA came to say;
"My EDWIN live for me."

stanzas.stanza_text:
But oh! his sister's jealous care,
A cruel sister she!
Forbade what EMMA came to say;
"My EDWIN live for me."

lines.line_text: Now homeward as she hopeless wept
The church-yard path along,
The blast blew cold, the dark owl scream'd
Her lover's funeral song.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Now homeward as she hopeless wept
The church-yard path along,
The blast blew cold, the dark owl scream'd
Her lover's funeral song.

lines.line_text: Amid the falling gloom of night,
Her startling fancy found
In every bush his hovering shade,
His groan in every sound.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Amid the falling gloom of night,
Her startling fancy found
In every bush his hovering shade,
His groan in every sound.

lines.line_text: Alone, appall'd, thus had she pass'd
The visionary vale
When lo! the death-bell smote her ear,
Sad-sounding in the gale!

stanzas.stanza_text:
Alone, appall'd, thus had she pass'd
The visionary vale 
When lo! the death-bell smote her ear,
Sad-sounding in the gale!

lines.line_text: Just then she reach'd, with trembling step,
Her aged mother's door
He's gone! she cry'd; and I shall see
That angel-face no more!

stanzas.stanza_text:
Just then she reach'd, with trembling step,
Her aged mother's door 
He's gone! she cry'd; and I shall see
That angel-face no more!

lines.line_text: I feel, I feel this breaking heart
Beat high against my side
From her white arm down sunk her head;
She shivering sigh'd, and died.

stanzas.stanza_text:
I feel, I feel this breaking heart
Beat high against my side 
From her white arm down sunk her head;
She shivering sigh'd, and died.
